overview: Jan Mellegers has been interim President and CEO of Genizon BioSciences since November 2008. He is also CEO of Biotech Turnaround Fund (BTF) which he founded in October 2000, building on his broad experience in international financial markets and his experience with investing in biotech companies for more than 19 years. Jan started his career in 1973 in the Dutch Air Force and received his pilot training in Canada. He flew close to 2,500 hours in fighter planes, was promoted to section leader, flew many hours in the Air Force NF-5 Demonstration Team, and was NF-5 test pilot for many years. In 1982, Jan joined Drexel Burnham Lambert and managed their Amsterdam securities office which was later taken over by Wertheim Schroder. From 1990 onwards, Jan started to invest in biotechnology companies.
